projectPurpose: To provide a programming language specifically designed for teaching and learning programming concepts.
mainFeatures: Designed as an educational programming language

alternatives.name: Scratch
alternatives.license: Open Source - GNU Affero General Public License (AGPL) v3.0 (Scratch 3.0), BSD 3-Clause (earlier 3.0), GPLv2 and Scratch Source Code License (1.x)
mainFeatures: Easy creation of interactive stories, games, and animations

alternatives.name: Blockly
mainFeatures: Generates code in various text-based languages

alternatives.name: Python
alternatives.license: Open Source - Python Software Foundation License

alternatives.name: Processing
alternatives.license: Open Source - GNU GPL and LGPL
mainFeatures: Designed for visual arts and teaching programming fundamentals
Easy creation of graphics, animations, and interactive applications

alternatives.name: Racket
mainFeatures: Includes DrRacket IDE tailored for learning
Used in computer science education and research

alternatives.name: Free Pascal
alternatives.license: Open Source - GPL (compiler), LGPL with static linking exception (libraries)

marketPositioning: Positioned as a new educational programming language, 'good_training_language' enters a market with established visual (Scratch, Blockly) and text-based (Python, Racket, Pascal, Processing) alternatives. Its specific niche or unique selling proposition is not explicitly detailed in the metadata, but the name suggests a focus on providing a beneficial learning experience. It likely aims to appeal to educators and learners seeking an alternative text-based language, potentially one with a specific design philosophy or set of features tailored for a particular pedagogical approach or curriculum, distinguishing itself from more general-purpose languages used in education.
